intro: Agathophyllum lastellei, commonly known as the lastellei agathophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, exhibiting adaptations to dry environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and pinnately divided, which helps reduce water loss. Agathophyllum lastellei is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
